availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James D. Rees (Kenton County, Kentucky, farmer and carpenter.)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, farmer and carpenter. Virginia native. Son of Joseph Rees and Maria Rees. Married to Elizabeth Rees. Father of Martha Rees and Bettie Rees. Married to Mary Hughes Rees. Stepfather of Victoria Hughes, Edward Hughes, Granville Hughes, John Hughes, Caledonia Hughes, and Clay Hughes. Farmer in Ludlow, Ohio, in 1850. Carpenter in Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky in 1860. Juror in the case of William Nichols in Kenton County.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Washington County, Ludlow, p. 500A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 6, p. 850.
